basics.name: Mohammad Raihanul Bashar
basics.label: Graduate Researcher
basics.summary: Graduate researcher specializing in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), eXtended Reality (XR), and 3D User Interfaces.

work.summary: Research and development internship focused on innovative technologies in healthcare.

work.institution: Gina Cody School of Engineering and Computer Science
work.summary: Supported game development and HCI courses with hands-on demonstrations and evaluations
Led web applications and ML-assisted annotation services, including the development of in-house platforms
Trained AI agents, developed esports prediction systems, and supervised ML engineering projects.

education.summary: Fast-tracked MSc to PhD focusing on HCI and Extended Reality under Dr. Anil Ufuk Batmaz.
Completed with a thesis on EEG signal processing for video category classification.

publications.name: Virtual Task Environments Factors Explored in 3D Selection Studies
publications.summary: This study analyzes 909 HCI papers from major repositories to classify virtual task environments in 3D selection methods, offering insights into user studies and advancing virtual interaction understanding.

publications.name: Subtask-Based Virtual Hand Visualization Method for Enhanced User Accuracy in Virtual Reality Environments
publications.summary: The paper presents a subtask-based virtual hand visualization method designed to improve user accuracy and interaction performance in virtual reality environments.

publications.name: EEG-Based Preference Classification for Neuromarketing Application
publications.summary: The paper explores the use of EEG signals to classify user preferences for neuromarketing applications, aiming to enhance consumer behavior insights through brain-computer interface technologies.

publications.name: Use of spontaneous blinking for application in human authentication
publications.summary: The paper investigates the potential of spontaneous blinking patterns as a biometric feature for reliable human authentication.

publications.name: Effect of Artefact Removal Techniques on EEG Signals for Video Category Classification
publications.summary: The study evaluates how different artifact removal techniques, specifically Stationary Wavelet Transform (SWT) and an extended SWT technique (SWTSD), impact the accuracy of EEG-based video category classification, finding that SWTSD can improve classification accuracy by up to 7.2%.

publications.name: Computational Intelligence for Pattern Recognition in EEG Signals
publications.summary: The chapter discusses how computational intelligence techniques enhance pattern recognition in EEG signals, improving applications in medicine, psychology, and rehabilitation.

publications.name: Effect of EMG artifacts on video category classification from EEG
publications.summary: The study examines the impact of EMG artifacts on EEG signals used for video category classification, highlighting that the presence of EMG artifacts can significantly affect classification performance.

publications.name: Implementation of Low Cost Stereo Humanoid Adaptive Vision for 3D Positioning and Distance Measurement for Robotics Application with Self-Calibration
publications.summary: The paper presents a low-cost stereo vision system for humanoid robots, enabling 3D positioning and distance measurement with self-calibration capabilities.

publications.name: Video Category Classification Using Wireless EEG
publications.summary: The study demonstrates that EEG signals recorded via a wireless headset can be analyzed to classify the genre of videos being watched, achieving up to 80% accuracy, with the right frontal lobe (AF8 channel) providing the most predictive data.

publications.name: 2D Surface Mapping for Mine Detection via Wireless Networking
publications.summary: The paper presents a prototype mapping robot system, MinerBot, designed to create real-time 2D surface maps of areas, aiding in mine detection.
